It's a lot classier than I had anticipated. Though the bathroom was as terrible as the other reviews describe.

Service was minimal but adequately efficient. Friendlier than i expected. My friend and I got a free bowl of soup!

A lot of old Chinese people and Chinese families were there, a good sign for authenticity.

Consider me a regular!
author: K C.

description: Absolutely love this place!  I always come here when we have dinner with my grandmother.  At one point we were here almost every single week. The owners and workers are always nice. Their food portions are pretty big for the price they charge.   Every time we come here we either get the Peking spareribs or the salt & pepper spareribs.  Thinking of it makes my mouth watery now!
author: Alexis T.

description:
We happened upon this restaurant and decided to give it a try.  The food was excellent, the service was friendly, fast and helpful.  We really enjoyed this place and would definitely go back.

Green beans with garlic (not on menu, but we asked for them) were very garlicy and wonderful.  Seafood combo was yummy, cashew chicken, all excellent.
author: Sherry B.

description: This is my best Chinese restaurant in San Francisco. I tried a few restaurant in China town and found this one gives me the most tasty food. I went there 3 years ago and I went there last week twice. I love the river snail and frog. Other dishes are also good.
author: Harry C.

description: Used to always come here as a kid, but don't remember how any of that tasted like. Came here about a year ago and the food was pretty good. I remembered liking the fish.
author: Elaine H.

description: I just drove 3hours from Ft Bragg and was starving - didn't want fast food but good hot food that was reasonable in cost. I've passed this place often but never entered; today I went down the front steps to investigate...  it was worth it! The restaurant was crowded with asian groups and even some tourists who seemed to be enjoying their food. The tables were filled with plates of food, and the air was bustling with small talk from everyone - I was happy. Ordered a beef wonton soup - hey, it's COLD! Also ordered a plate of beef with thick chinese noodles with broccoli; both were served quickly and steaming hot!! I was in and out within 40minutes, and even drank two cups of tea and paid LESS than $25, with leftovers to take home and enjoy later! Cannot beat that!!! No parking but worth the walk!
author: Tony L.

description: My friend and I were walking along one of the main streets (Powell I think) but we couldn't find anything good.  So we turned down a side street and found this place.  The menu looked good (plus we were really hungry) so we went down.  I ordered the curry chicken plate and she had vegetables and rice.  It was pretty good, and I figured if the old Chinese men were in there, it couldn't have been bad.
author: Geoff Y.

description:
I made Togo order from this restaurant on 01/23/09 because this location is easy to access. First , when I got there around 6pm, there were only have few people dinning in. the restaurant was messing. It took me more than 40mins for 4items. 
when I paid for it, it seems that bill was higher than supposed to be, I have questioned the waiter and he mentioned that for "Togo" orders, customer have to paid for container which never mentioned at first place, that's fine, but when I went home and found out they "Extra Charged" 

I will never never go to this dishonest restaurant ... so sad for this Cheating place!!
author: J C.

description: Great service, free soup, and very affordable. gotta love chinatown.
author: drew w.

description: Surprisingly this place isn't bad for a hole in the ground. I was a bit disgusted that downstairs I think one of their pipes had burst and it was oozing water..but once you got over it, the foood was great at lunch time with very cheap prices. I liked the wonton soup we had and also fried rice - I forgot which type it was but it wasn't on the lunch menu... a bit more expensive. Overall a great deal @ lunch, prob not the premiere place for dinner, but I'd come back for a cheap chinese lunch!
author: Jeannette L.

description: They hide the city health inspection sign and rating behind some papers on the wall so you can't tell their rating.  Also the plate lunch had some clumpy and hard rice bits.  It made me think they were recycling leftover rice from rice containers on other people's tables.  I didn't get sick but it's not good to be worrying about that while eating either.  This is hole in the wall should remain hidden.
author: Edmund W.

description: when did this place reopen?  when i use to come here, the staff loved me and my cracker arse friends. :)
author: Pickle R.

description:
food taste = 4
price / value = 4
service = 3
environment = 3

great taste, decent price.  especially for lunch.  they're not fast food, so you're not going to get your food in 5 min. but at least you know they're preparing it and not re-heating it.

i grew up with chinese restaurants, so the environment and the avg service does not bother me - i expect it.  it's not going to fool anyone into thinking it's fine dining.  it's hard to go wrong here.
author: Bryce K.

description: Came here once with my friends and just came here the other day . This place is kind of hidden because its underground downstairs but I love this place ! Never would of thought a place like this would serve such good food . The chili pepper beef chow fun was really tasty . It was full flavor and spicy just the way I like it . The tender green with steak cubes was good . The greens were well cooked and full of flavor but the steak cubes were really hard to swallow . The eggplant with salted fish in clay pot was my favorite . It too salty like a lot of other places .. but just right . It looks oily and everything but it's really good ! You can really taste the salted fish . They put just the right amount of flavor in it . The food here is anything but dull . Prices are reasonable .  Don't see much young people here because I think it's targeted mainly to older folks . A great place to go for a family dinner . I love the atmosphere of this place . This hole-in-the-wall is definitely worth a try ! I promise you wont be disappointed .
author: Eileen L.

description: Hidden gem...downstairs.  Large portions and very yummy.  The fresh fish is a must try if you like fish.  All the seafood dishes are very fresh and tasty.  Lunch is very good and portions are again very large.  Highly recommend this place for anyone who loves authentic Cantonese cooking.
author: Linda C.
